title: Stray dummy span in trait bound JSON error message

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I tried this code:

```rust
fn main() {
    bar::Bar::new("1");
}
```

And in a dependency bar:

```rust
pub struct Bar;

impl Bar {
    pub fn new<E>(e: E) -> Self
        where E: std::error::Error
    {
        Bar
    }
}
```

With the JSON error format, this includes the following message:

```javascript
{
  "byte_end": 0,
  "byte_start": 0,
  "column_end": 1,
  "column_start": 1,
  "expansion": null,
  "file_name": "src/main.rs",
  "is_primary": false,
  "label": "required by a bound in this",
  "line_end": 1,
  "line_start": 1,
  "suggested_replacement": null,
  "suggestion_applicability": null,
  "text": []
},
```

This message (`required by a bound in this`) is pointing to a dummy span. I'm guessing that it is trying to point to something in the extern dependency?

I expected to see this happen: I do not expect any JSON messages to include dummy spans.

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.51.0 (2fd73fabe 2021-03-23)

commit-hash: 2fd73fabe469357a12c2c974c140f67e7cdd76d0

LLVM version: 11.0.1
```
